reviews.sentence: Very Hospitable WONDERFUL LOCATION. My stay was absolutely wonderful the only reason I did not give a 5 star rating is because they do not furnish microwaves in the rooms there is one you can use in the lobby. The staff was VERY ACCOMMODATING to any request I may have had from shuttle service to great restaurants. Also if you are hungry or in need of a drink make sure to stop by the grill and see Brenda. She truly made me feel right at home. Thanks guys. If I return to Atlanta I ALREADY know where I am staying.
Convenient to Downtown. Had asked for two Double Beds. Instead got one King and small Sleeper Sofa. My son graciously took the sleeper and was uncomfortable both nights. Lovely breakfast great staff.

Will happily stay there whenever I get to Atlanta. Great staff. Very friendly and helpful and were always in good spirits. Loved the courtyard out back and the patio furniture was awesome. Location was terrific and the Bistro on the lobby floor was great tothe price was pretty high but I think the rates were jacked up that week for the NCA swimming championships which were held at Georgia Tech.

Average. We did not chose this hotel. We were mishandled by SpringHil Suites Atlanta Airport who DOES NOT honor confirmed reservations. We were sent here after much waiting. The front desk worker Tyrone was friendly and quickly got us a room. The room was very small. The bed very firm and their pull out couch only good for a small child to sleep. We were a family of four. The bathroom door was dirty. I would not recommend or ever stay at this property in the future. It is close to the highway so you hear cars all night long. The one good thing is a cafe that gets top marks and is within walking distance.
The bed was very comfortable and the whole place was great. The bar had great food too.

Pride Weekend. We needed a weekend getaway to attend the festival in Atlanta and found this hotel with a great deal. The hotel was in a great location only a 20 minute walk to Piedmont park and all the restaurants. The room was very spacious with a kind bed and sofa bed. The room had a really nice size bathroom and mini fridge. The view out the window was not the best and you can hear people on the roof below. But other than that the hotel was good. The breakfast bar with coffee and drinks in the morning is a very great touch and the hotel had plenty of parking. Will definitely come back here. Way better than the last hotel we stayed at. Also we had a really cute welcome note from our housekeeper. Great personable touch.

Atlanta Brithday Trip. The staff was excellent at the front desk and the Bristol bar. The housekeeper staff we had to call to front desk. We was there for two days had to call for clean towels and we made our beds up.

Great location and friendly staff. This hotel is very close to Georgia Tech and downtown without being in the heart of the city. Check in was easy and the staff was very nice. Parking was convenient since you are not right downtown. Ear plugs were provided but we could not hear the traffic anyway. You are close to the highway. There is a cafe that serves meals and Starbucks which was nice in the morning.

Very Good. Comfortable softish bed nice shower and towels. Good AC and decent wifi. Clean. Fairly quiet for a hotel. I did not have a car and the location was several blocks from the restaurants in Midtown. I do not think it is technically in Midtown. However the location is great if you have a car with lots of free parking.
Every thing was ok but it was not have buffet breakfast which is very enjoyable for me.

Great location great staff clean comfortable but missing a few complimentary items like microwave. The room was well appointed and comfortable. Bed was great. Pullout couch was a bonus. The staff was great. The manger got me a free cup of coffee when I asked for one before the bistro was officially open. The fitness room was good. The bistro was good and the woman working there was very nice. I wish there had been a microwave. Parking was expensive but commensurate with other hotels in the area. I wish there had been free breakfast. The bistro was crowded on Saturday am. I opted to go out because it looked too busy and I could get Chick fil A for less money.

A good group venue. They handled our group of 136 pl very easily. While their meeting rooms were not large they provided hot breakfast service efficiently and well for the two days we were there. We also had a medical emergency with someone in our group and the hotel staff were accommodating with everything we needed. Courtney was great.

Newly Remodeled. I had a quick trip into Atlanta for Mart and I have stayed at this hotel many many times but it was a nice surprise to see that they had remodeled the rooms from a rusty red to a cooler blue and gray look. l really liked the couch they used in the corner. So for some helpful info for traveling ans staying here at this courtyard is its easy to get in and out. They do nt charge for parking like every other hotel in Atlanta. There is a great place to have breakfast around the corner called the Silver Skillet. Its been there for ever. They have a convenient store of those things you might have forgotten to pack like Rolaids or tooth paste. The only complaint I have and this goes for about every Mariot out there is they have terrible toilet paper.
Nice hotel in a decent area. A little bit too far to the restaurants and bars in the area of you are walking.

Adaquate and a good location for family to gather. Good location for Georgia Tech vGraduation. Strange seatingfurniture in the room uncomfortable and not very user friendly. Breakfast Service at lobby snack bar was very slow as there were only two persons working and a large crowd. Disliked the tiny coffee cups.

Hotel provided great customer service as well as a very nice setting for tourists. Many rooms are given balconies along with a great view of the nearby Interstate as well as buildings which looks extremely pretty especially at night time. There is a pool outside which can be used to relax and the breakfast provided in the morning is very high quality and worked very hard. Overall a great hotel to stay in.
The room was too small and on the back end of the hotel. Definitely NOT worth the 200 charge. Little amenities small lobby like and restaurant. Very disappointed with the hotel.

The rooms are ok though I would say a bit on the small size especially considering the price they charge but they are clean and you have all the necessities. Breakfast is not good at all the bistro has a very small selection of items and they are very expensive. you are better off going out for your breakfast there is a dinner next door where you can get a much better deal. Staff are very welcoming and helpful.

Here on business. And the hotel was adequate for the stay. I found the staff to be friendly and very helpful rooms were kept clean as is the hotel itself. It has the normal bistro if you do not wish to go elsewhere for snack dinner breakfast. The one thing that must be noted is that there is a local shuttle that can get you anywhere in the midtown area. I bring this up because the web site does not state it an an amenity and it definitely sets this hotel apart from some of the others in the area. Laurie and Victor drive the shuttle both are professional and personable really appreciate them at the beginning and end of a work day.

Nice place but nothing in walking distance. Cold and colder. Nothing in the area that you can walk to. No free breakfast pay only and 22 a night to park. A lot of money for what you get. Altlanta traffic is a killer.

The Perfect Port In The Storm. I arrived at this hotel on Wednesday July 10 so I could tour the city before and after my nieces wedding reception. Jonathan Gray at the front desk was extremely helpful. so much so that when my brother who accompanied me was unable to get to his Air BNB he was allowed to stay for just one night. Despite what other reviewers have said about the noise from the traffic I experienced none of that during my sleeping hours. Perhaps it was due to being on the 3rd floor. At any rate I had no trouble sleeping or showering. I ate at the bistro only three times but the food was very savory. I also found time for the fitness center business center and the pool. I only used the shuttle to go to and from the Silver Skillet. Laurie the driver was very friendly and helpful. Checking out this morning at an unusually early hour to go to the airport was easily done. I do not know if I will ever return to Atlanta but I will only stay here again if the other nearby hotels are all booked up like they were this week.

Plus and minus Comfortable bed quiet room despite being downtown. Courtyard area very nice. Room was extremely small. Prepaid breakfast was a joke. Bottle of water by coffee maker is 60Think they are hoping you use it for coffee and do not notice2 small packages of MMs were almost 70.

The staff at this hotel was wonderful. Everyone was helpful and cheerful. Our problem was with the hotel itself. When paying the rates we paid I do not expect the toilet paper at a festival porta potty to be of superior quality than that of my hotel room but that is what we had. Additionally the Bistro was out of almost everything when we attempted to have dinner there Friday night and even was out of the drinks we wanted. We had tickets to an event and needed to print them. Unfortunately the computers and printers in the business center were not working. Fortunately one of the staff allowed us to email the tickets to her for her to print for us. Finally we had to have our bill straightened out because their system charged us twice for parking. Honestly I expected better more from the hotel.
